tiers.gateway: Beginner-friendly content (weeks 1-8). Slow, clear speech. Often designed for learners.
tiers.bridge: Intermediate content (months 2-6). Real Ukrainian but accessible. Transcripts help.
tiers.native: Full-speed native content (month 6+). What Ukrainians actually watch/listen to.

content.title: Ukrainian Lessons Podcast
content.description: Specifically designed for learners. Each episode teaches vocabulary through stories and conversations. Host speaks clearly and explains in English.
content.whyIncluded: Gold standard for beginner listening. Perfect for commute. Start with Season 1, Episode 1.

content.title: Easy Ukrainian (Easy Languages)
content.description: Street interviews with real Ukrainians. Subtitles in Ukrainian AND English simultaneously. Great for connecting written and spoken forms.
content.whyIncluded: Dual subtitles are perfect for the 'notice the gap' phase. Real people, natural speech, but fully supported.
content.startHere: Any episode that interests you - topic matters more than order

content.title: Ukrainian Lessons (Anna Ohoiko)
content.description: Clear, teacher-style explanations. Good for understanding patterns and rules. Supplements pure input with some explicit instruction.
content.whyIncluded: When you want to understand WHY something works, not just hear it. Good complement to pure input.

content.title: Ukraїner Documentary Series
content.description: Stunning documentaries about Ukrainian regions, people, crafts, and traditions. Beautiful cinematography, real interviews, subtitle support.
content.whyIncluded: Your historical interests align perfectly here. Emotionally engaging content makes input stick. Start with English subs, graduate to Ukrainian subs.
content.startHere: Pick a region or topic that interests you most

content.title: 1+1 News (with subtitles)
content.description: Major Ukrainian news channel. Formal, clear speech. Use auto-generated subtitles. Good for current events.
content.whyIncluded: News anchors speak clearly. Current events create urgency to understand. Save for month 3+.
content.startHere: Wait until you have 50+ hours of input

content.title: Servant of the People (Слуга Народу)
content.description: The comedy series where Zelensky played a teacher who becomes president. Now historically fascinating. Natural dialogue, humor helps engagement.
content.whyIncluded: Compelling story you'll WANT to understand. Pre-knowledge of Zelensky helps comprehension. Comedy is great for acquisition.

content.title: Modern Ukrainian Music Mix
content.description: Music is the secret weapon. Emotional, repetitive, catchy. Lyrics burn into memory without effort.
content.whyIncluded: Nothing beats music for emotional encoding. Find lyrics online, listen repeatedly.

suggestedArtists.name: Okean Elzy (Океан Ельзи)
suggestedArtists.why: Ukraine's biggest rock band. Clear vocals, emotional songs.

suggestedArtists.name: KAZKA
suggestedArtists.why: Modern pop with folk elements. Catchy, widely known.

content.title: Ukrainian Children's Audiobooks
content.description: Children's stories read aloud. Simple vocabulary, clear pronunciation, repetitive structures. Don't skip this - it's not beneath you.
content.whyIncluded: Krashen's research shows children's content is IDEAL for adult learners. Simple structures, high repetition, complete comprehensibility.
content.startHere: Search 'українська казка аудіо' (Ukrainian fairy tale audio)

content.title: Radio Svoboda Ukraine
content.description: Professional journalism in Ukrainian. Clear but full-speed native speech. Current events focus.
content.whyIncluded: Goal content - this is what fluency sounds like. Save for month 6+.
content.startHere: Wait until you can follow 60%+ of bridge content

content.title: Hromadske TV
content.description: Independent Ukrainian media. Interviews, analysis, documentaries. Full native speed.
content.whyIncluded: Authentic journalism. Multiple speakers with natural interruptions. Advanced goal content.

content.title: Ukrainian TikTok/Shorts
content.description: Short-form content. Slang, humor, trends. Window into how young Ukrainians actually talk.
content.whyIncluded: Cultural immersion. Understand your colleagues' humor references. Low-stakes, high-repetition.

week1_4.notes: Focus on Cyrillic Trainer first. Listen to music casually. Start podcast from Episode 1.

week5_8.notes: Should be reading Cyrillic now. Add children's audiobooks. Music with lyrics displayed.

month2_3.notes: Start Ukrainer with English subs, move to Ukrainian subs. Begin Servant of the People.

month4_6.notes: Ukrainian subs only. Add news clips. Notice how much more you understand.

month6_plus.notes: Graduate to no subtitles. Follow your interests. You're acquiring now, not studying.
